intro: Anisophyllum bahiense, commonly known as the Bahamian fern, is a rare and unique plant native to the Bahamas. It is a member of the Blechnaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near freshwater sources. Its reproductive structures are small and inconspicuous, contributing to its limited distribution. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
